title: The Ocean Club restaurant opens in Martha’s Vineyard landmark bank building
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: The Ocean Club restaurant opens on Aug. 27 in the historic Martha’s Vineyard bank building at 75 Main St.
Led by chef Marc Orfaly, the menu features local seafood, handmade pasta, and a planned raw bar.
The restaurant retains original architectural elements and includes a 20-seat bar, private dining room, and wine cellar.

title: Saving pamphlets, receipts, and wrappers: Young people take on junk journaling
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Junk journaling, a trend among younger generations, involves using paper items like receipts and tickets to create personal collages.
Lauren Clark, owner of Found and Flowered in Greater Boston, provides materials and hosts events for junk journaling enthusiasts.
Junk journaling has gained popularity online and in workshops, appealing to Millennials and Gen Z for its tactile and creative process.

title: Review & setlist: My Chemical Romance skewers fascism at Fenway Park
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: My Chemical Romance performed a theatrical concert at Fenway Park, exploring themes of authoritarianism and complicity through their music.
The band's performance included provocative imagery and storylines, with uniformed actors and a staged firing squad as part of the show.
After an elaborate set, the band switched to a second performance without costumes, featuring songs beyond their album 'The Black Parade'.

title: After serial shoplifters swipe $18K in sunglasses at Faneuil Hall, police issue request for tips
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Serial shoplifters stole around $18,000 in sunglasses from the Sunglass Hut at Faneuil Hall over seven incidents.
The thefts occurred between June 7 and August 25, typically on weekdays between 2 and 4:30 p.m.
Boston Police urge anyone with information to contact District A-1 Detectives or use anonymous tip lines.

title: Boy, 14, shot in Brockton
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A 14-year-old boy was shot near Francis Street and Manners Avenue in Brockton on Sunday evening.
The injured boy was transported to a local hospital with nonlife-threatening injuries.
Police reported a silver vehicle fleeing the scene; the investigation is ongoing.

title: Feds arrest 171 suspected members of drug cartel in New England, including 49 in Mass.
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: DEA arrested 171 Sinaloa Cartel members in New England, including 49 in Massachusetts, as part of a nationwide crackdown.
The operation seized $1.3 million, 33 guns, and 244 kilograms of drugs in New England alone in August.
Nationwide, 617 suspects were arrested, with $11 million, 420 firearms, and over 714,000 counterfeit pills seized.

title: Holidays not on the “calendar”
author: Pattie Hunt Sinacole
bullets: Floating holidays allow employees to take personal or lesser-known holidays off, like Diwali or Chinese New Year's Day.
These holidays generally require prior approval and are often paid for full-time employees, unpaid for part-time staff.
Employers may benefit from floating holidays, easing scheduling during popular holiday times with varied employee off-days.

title: Stefon Diggs talked about his Patriots debut, and the respect he has for Mike Vrabel
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Stefon Diggs made six catches for 57 yards in his Patriots debut during their 20-13 loss to the Raiders.
Diggs is continuing his rehab from a 2024 ACL tear and feels he's ahead of schedule despite the loss.
Diggs praised Patriots head coach Mike Vrabel, expressing strong respect and dedication to his guidance.

title: Readers: What’s your favorite spot for apple picking?
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Boston.com seeks reader input to update guide on best apple orchards in Massachusetts.
Hollis Hills Farms and Red Apple Farm featured among top USA Today apple orchards.
Honey Pot Hill Orchards voted favorite by Boston.com readers in 2023; new vote underway for 2025.

title: Photos: Highlights from Day 2 at Seisiún Irish music festival in Boston
author: Boston.com
bullets: Day 2 of the Seisiún Irish music festival at Suffolk Downs featured performances by The Waterboys, Glen Hansard, and The Pogues.
Attendees at the festival stayed dry with ponchos despite wet weather as they enjoyed live music from several bands.
Photographer Ben Stas captured colorful moments including a sunset before The Waterboys' set during the festival.
